short_description: Known as the 'Warm Heart of Africa', Malawi offers travelers stunning landscapes, friendly people, and abundant wildlife. Go on safari in Liwonde National Park, kayak on Lake Malawi, or simply soak up the sun on the beach

weather.title: Malawi has a tropical climate with hot summers and cool, dry winters. It experiences a wet season from November to April, with heavy rainfall and high humidity, while the dry season from May to October has lower humidity and less rainfall

when_to_visit.title: Dry season
when_to_visit.short_description: Minimal rainfall, clear skies and warm temperatures, making it ideal for outdoor activities

when_to_visit.title: Off peak season
when_to_visit.short_description: Fewer crowds and lower prices. Landscapes are still green and lush providing great scenery for photography and exploration

when_to_visit.title: Wildlife sighting
when_to_visit.short_description: Peak tourist season when the weather is dry and sunny. Excellent for enthusiasts as animals gather around water sources. Lake Malawi is also at its clearest during this period

when_to_visit.title: Birdwatching
when_to_visit.short_description: Popular for birdwatching as migratory birds start to arrive in Malawi, adding to the already rich birdlife of the region

when_to_visit.title: Wet season
when_to_visit.short_description: Heavy rainfall which can make some areas challenging to access. Increased risk of malaria in many regions

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Malawi is during the dry season from May to October when you can enjoy pleasant temperatures, clear skies, and excellent wildlife viewing and hiking opportunities
